servinfo.title: DTC P2241 / P2242: O2 Sensor Positive Current Control Circuit Low / High (Sensor-1, Bank-2)

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P2240: O2 Sensor Positive Current Control Circuit / Open (Sensor-1, Bank-2)

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: DTC P2241 O2 Sensor Positive Current Control Circuit Low (Sensor-1, Bank-2):

entry.ptxt: Circuit voltage of A/F sensor (+) terminal is lower than 0.4 V or A/F sensor circuit is short between (+) terminal wire and (–) terminal wire with engine running.

ptxt.emph: DTC P2242 O2 Sensor Positive Current Control Circuit High (Sensor-1, Bank-2):

entry.ptxt: Circuit voltage of A/F sensor (+) terminal is higher than 3.5 V with engine running

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that following conditions are satisfied when using this “DTC Confirmation Procedure”.

item.ptxt: The following DTC is not detected: A/F sensor heater

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool to DLC.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: A/F sensor signal check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool with ignition switch turned OFF.
Warm up engine to normal operating temperature and keep it at 2000 r/min. for 60 sec.
Repeat racing engine (Repeat depressing accelerator pedal 5 to 6 times continuously to enrich A/F mixture and take foot off from pedal to enlean it).
Check for A/F sensor (bank-2) output current displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Does A/F sensor output current between –0.2 mA and 0.2 mA?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from A/F sensor (bank-2) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper terminal connection to A/F sensor (bank-2) connector and ECM connector.
If connections are OK, check that A/F sensor (bank-2) circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of each “Signal (+) circuit of A/F sensor (bank-2)”, “Signal (–) circuit of A/F sensor (bank-2)” is less than 1 Ω.
Insulation resistance between “Signal (+) circuit of A/F sensor (bank-2)” and vehicle body ground is infinity.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between “Signal (+) circuit of A/F sensor (bank-2)” terminal and each other terminal at A/F sensor (bank-2) connector.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between “Signal (–) circuit of A/F sensor (bank-2)” terminal and each other terminal at A/F sensor (bank-2) connector.
Circuit voltage between “Signal (+) circuit of A/F sensor (bank-2)” and vehicle body ground is 0 V with ignition switch tuned ON.

testgroup.title: A/F sensor heater check

test1.ptxt: Check A/F sensor (bank-2) referring to Air Fuel Ratio (A/F) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is A/F sensor heater in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck. if ECM OK, replace A/F sensor (bank-2).
